instruction: Describe the similarities and differences between a zoo and an aquarium.
output: Both zoos and aquariums feature animals contained in enclosures, although the type of animals vary between the two. Zoos feature a variety of warm-blooded and terrestrial animals such as mammals, reptiles, and birds. Aquariums feature aquatic or marine animals such as fish, jellyfish, and aquatic mammals. Both zoos and aquariums have educational aspects to help visitors learning about animals and the environment, although aquariums may also have interactive displays such as touch tanks.
